member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.ConnectionBase
member.summary:
The ConnectionBase class is a base class for defining connections, details and seams. These types are more specialized and restricted by the input values than the ones derived from PluginBase.
The coordinate system for connections, details and seams is explained in the Tekla Structures help, in the part about the position type of custom components. The position type defines the origin of the custom component, relative to the main part.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.ConnectionBase.InputObjects
member.summary: The actual list of inputs, same as for PluginBase.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.ConnectionBase._Positions
member.summary: Position attributes from InputObjects.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.ConnectionBase._Secondaries
member.summary: Secondary objects from InputObjects.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.ConnectionBase._Identifier
member.summary: The identifier of the executable plug-in instance.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.ConnectionBase._Code
member.summary: The code of the executable connection instance.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.ConnectionBase.Run
member.summary: The main method of the component. Inside Run the user can implement the logic based on the user given attributes and input. Inside the method input can be found from the provided properties: Primary, Secondaries and Positions.
member.returns: True on success.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.ConnectionBase.IsDefaultValue(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns true if the given value is set to the default value for this type.
member.returns: True if the value is set to the default.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.ConnectionBase.IsDefaultValue(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns true if the given value is set to the default value for this type.
member.returns: True if the value is set to the default.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.ConnectionBase.IsDefaultValue(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if the given value is set to the default value (empty string).
member.returns: True if the value is set to the default.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.ConnectionBase.GetConnectionCode
member.summary: Gets the connection code and sets to be the gotten code.
member.returns: Always true.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.ConnectionBase.SetConnectionCode
member.summary: Sets the connection code to be the value of .
member.exception: Thrown when the length of exceeds 22 characters.
member.returns: True if the connection code was successfully set.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.ConnectionBase.Identifier
member.summary: The identifier of the executable plug-in instance.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.ConnectionBase.Code
member.summary: The connection code of the executable connection instance. The maximum length is 22 characters.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.ConnectionBase.Primary
member.summary: The identifier that was selected as the primary object.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.ConnectionBase.Positions
member.summary: The positional attributes for a detail or a seam instance; one for a detail, N for a seam.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.ConnectionBase.Secondaries
member.summary: A list of secondary identifiers of a connection or a seam.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.ConnectionBase.SecondaryType
member.summary: Defines how many secondaries a connection can have.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.ConnectionBase.SecondaryType.SECONDARYTYPE_ZERO
member.summary: The connection can have zero secondaries. Zero secondaries means that the connection is a detail.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.ConnectionBase.SecondaryType.SECONDARYTYPE_ONE
member.summary: The connection can have one secondary.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.ConnectionBase.SecondaryType.SECONDARYTYPE_TWO
member.summary: The connection can have two secondaries.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.ConnectionBase.SecondaryType.SECONDARYTYPE_MULTIPLE
member.summary: The connection can have multiple secondaries.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.ConnectionBase.InputObjectType
member.summary: Defines the input object type.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.ConnectionBase.InputObjectType.INPUTOBJECT_PART
member.summary: The input object is a part instance.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.ConnectionBase.InputObjectType.INPUTOBJECT_CUSTOMPART
member.summary: The input object can be a custom part (component).

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.ConnectionBase.SeamInputType
member.summary: Defines the type of the input.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.ConnectionBase.SeamInputType.INPUT_2_POINTS
member.summary: The input is two points. The data is returned as an array list of points.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.ConnectionBase.SeamInputType.INPUT_POLYGON
member.summary: The input is any number of points (a polygon). The data is returned as an array list of points.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.SecondaryTypeAttribute
member.summary: The SecondaryTypeAttribute class is used for storing the number of needed secondaries in the connection. Based on the type the system can then correctly ask for user input in the creation. The attribute is initialized from the custom attribute i.e. [SecondaryType(ConnectionBase.SecondaryType.SECONDARYTYPE_ONE)] in the connection source.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.SecondaryTypeAttribute.#ctor(Tekla.Structures.Plugins.ConnectionBase.SecondaryType)
member.summary: The custom attribute [SecondaryType()] uses this to store the secondary type to the system. This is not to be used by itself.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.SecondaryTypeAttribute.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: The custom attribute [SecondaryType()] uses this to store the secondary type to the system. This is not to be used by itself.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.SecondaryTypeAttribute.Type
member.summary: The custom attribute [SecondaryType()] uses this to store the secondary type to the system. This is not to be used by itself.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.InputObjectTypeAttribute
member.summary: The InputObjectTypeAttribute class is used for storing the type of the input. Based on the type the system can then correctly ask for user input in the creation. The attribute is initialized from the custom attribute [InputObjectType(ConnectionBase.InputObjectType.INPUTOBJECT_PART)] in the connection source.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.InputObjectTypeAttribute.#ctor(Tekla.Structures.Plugins.ConnectionBase.InputObjectType)
member.summary: The custom attribute [InputObjectType()] uses this to store the input object type to the system. This is not to be used by itself.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.InputObjectTypeAttribute.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: The custom attribute [InputObjectType()] uses this to store the input object type to the system. This is not to be used by itself.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.InputObjectTypeAttribute.Type
member.summary: The custom attribute [InputObjectType()] uses this to store the input object type to the system. This is not to be used by itself.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.PositionTypeAttribute
member.summary: The PositionTypeAttribute class is used for storing the position type of the connection. Based on the type the system will then position the connection in the creation. The attribute is initialized from the custom attribute [PositionType(PositionTypeEnum.COLLISION_PLANE)] in the connection source.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.PositionTypeAttribute.#ctor(Tekla.Structures.PositionTypeEnum)
member.summary: The custom attribute [PositionType()] uses this to store the position type to the system. This is not to be used by itself.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.PositionTypeAttribute.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: The custom attribute [PositionType()] uses this to store the position type to the system. This is not to be used by itself.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.PositionTypeAttribute.Type
member.summary: The custom attribute [PositionType()] uses this to store the position type to the system. This is not to be used by itself.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.DetailTypeAttribute
member.summary: The DetailTypeAttribute class is used for storing the detail type. Based on the type the system will then position the detail in the creation. The attribute is initialized from the custom attribute [DetailType(DetailTypeEnum.END)] in the connection source.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.DetailTypeAttribute.#ctor(Tekla.Structures.DetailTypeEnum)
member.summary: The custom attribute [DetailType()] uses this to store the type of the detail to the system. This is not to be used by itself.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.DetailTypeAttribute.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: The custom attribute [DetailType()] uses this to store the type of the detail to the system. This is not to be used by itself.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.DetailTypeAttribute.Type
member.summary: The custom attribute [DetailType()] uses this to store the type of the detail to the system. This is not to be used by itself.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.AutoDirectionTypeAttribute
member.summary: The AutoDirectionTypeAttribute class is used for storing the auto direction type. Based on the type the system will then calculate the up direction of the connection/detail if the "Auto" up direction is chosen in the dialog. The attribute is initialized from the custom attribute [AutoDirectionType(AutoDirectionTypeEnum.AUTODIR_DETAIL)] in the connection/detail source.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.AutoDirectionTypeAttribute.#ctor(Tekla.Structures.AutoDirectionTypeEnum)
member.summary: The custom attribute [AutoDirectionType()] uses this to store the auto direction type to the system. This is not to be used by itself.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.AutoDirectionTypeAttribute.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: The custom attribute [AutoDirectionType()] uses this to store the auto direction type to the system. This is not to be used by itself.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.AutoDirectionTypeAttribute.Type
member.summary: The custom attribute [AutoDirectionType()] uses this to store the auto direction type to the system. This is not to be used by itself.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.SeamInputTypeAttribute
member.summary: The SeamInputTypeAttribute class is used for identifying that the connection is a seam and defining the input type. Based on the type the system will then ask for the correct number of input points in the creation. The attribute is initialized from the custom attribute [SeamInputType(ConnectionBase.SeamInputType.INPUT_POLYGON)] in the connection source.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.SeamInputTypeAttribute.#ctor(Tekla.Structures.Plugins.ConnectionBase.SeamInputType)
member.summary: The custom attribute [SeamInputType()] uses this to store the input type to the system. This is not to be used by itself.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.SeamInputTypeAttribute.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: The custom attribute [SeamInputType()] uses this to store the input type to the system. This is not to be used by itself.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.SeamInputTypeAttribute.Type
member.summary: The custom attribute [SeamInputType()] uses this to store the input type to the system. This is not to be used by itself.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.CustomPartBase
member.summary:
The CustomPartBase class is a base class for defining custom parts. These types are more specialized and restricted by the input values than the ones derived from PluginBase.
The coordinate system for connections, details and seams is explained in the Tekla Structures help, in the part about the position type of custom components. The position type defines the origin of the custom component, relative to the main part.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.CustomPartBase.InputObjects
member.summary: The actual list of inputs, same as for PluginBase.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.CustomPartBase._Positions
member.summary: Positions from Input.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.CustomPartBase._Identifier
member.summary: The identifier of the executable plug-in instance.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.CustomPartBase.Run
member.summary: The main method of the component. Inside Run the user can implement the logic based on the user given attributes and input. Inside the method input can be found from the provided properties: Primary, Secondaries and Positions.
member.returns: True on success.

member.summary: Returns true if the given value is set to the default value for this type.
member.returns: True if the value is set to the default.

member.summary: Returns true if the given value is set to the default value (empty string).

member.summary: The identifier of the executable plug-in instance.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.CustomPartBase.Positions
member.summary: The positional attributes for a custom part instance.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.CustomPartBase.CustomPartInputType
member.summary: Defines the type of the input. Not supported fully yet in core

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.CustomPartBase.CustomPartInputType.INPUT_2_POINTS
member.summary: The input is two points. The data is returned as an array list of points. Default value.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.CustomPartBase.CustomPartInputType.INPUT_MAX_10_POINTS
member.summary: The input is any number points (max 10 points). The data is returned as an array list of points.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.CustomPartInputTypeAttribute
member.summary: The CustomPartInputTypeAttribute class is used for identifying that the connection is a seam and defining the input type. Based on the type the system will then ask for the correct number of input points in the creation. The attribute is initialized from the custom attribute [CustomPartInputType(CustomPartBase.CustomPartInputType.INPUT_MAX_10_POINTS)] in the connection source. Not yet supported fully in core yet.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.CustomPartInputTypeAttribute.#ctor(Tekla.Structures.Plugins.CustomPartBase.CustomPartInputType)
member.summary: The custom attribute uses this to store the input type to the system. This is not to be used by itself.

member.summary: The custom attribute uses this to store the input type to the system. This is not to be used by itself.

member.summary: The custom attribute uses this to store the input type to the system. This is not to be used by itself.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.DrawingPluginBase
member.summary: The DrawingPluginBase class is an abstract base class for drawing plug-ins.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.DrawingPluginBase.InitializeLifetimeService
member.summary: Initializes the lifetime service.
member.returns: A lifetime service object to control the lifetime policy.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.DrawingPluginBase.Run(System.Collections.Generic.List{Tekla.Structures.Plugins.DrawingPluginBase.InputDefinition})
member.summary: The main method of the plug-in. It is called after the input has been defined with DefineInput(). This is the "main" method of the plug-in and should contain all the actual implementation.
member.param: An array list of the same format and order as what was returned from DefineInput().
member.returns: True on success.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.DrawingPluginBase.DefineInput
member.summary: The method Tekla Structures calls for the plug-in to query the input. The plug-in must then return an array list of input definition instances. The plug-in will be dependent on the items it returns. Dependent means that if any of these items change, for example the user moves the points, the plug-in will be re-run with new input. DefineInput is not called during the re-run, and thus all the actual implementation should be in the Run() method. The Run() method is always called in view coordinates.
member.returns: An array list of input definition instances. If the plug-in is not dependent on input, it should return an empty array list (not null).

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.DrawingPluginBase.IsDefaultValue(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns true if the given value is set to the default value for this type.
member.returns: True if the value is set to the default.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.DrawingPluginBase.IsDefaultValue(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns true if the given value is set to the default value for this type.
member.returns: True if the value is set to the default.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.DrawingPluginBase.IsDefaultValue(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if the given value is set to the default value (empty string).
member.returns: True if the value is set to the default.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.DrawingPluginBase.UpdateMode
member.summary: Defines the update mode of the drawing plug-in. The update mode tells the system when the plug-in is executed.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.DrawingPluginBase.UpdateMode.INPUT_CHANGED
member.summary: The plug-in is updated when the input is a point and the point is moved or when the input is an object and the object changes. The plug-in is executed when the input is an object and its properties are changed in the drawing editor. This mode is the default which is used if the update mode is not defined in the plug-in source.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.DrawingPluginBase.UpdateMode.DRAWING_OPENED
member.summary: The plug-in is updated also when a drawing is opened. The plug-in is executed when the input is changed or during drawing opening.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.DrawingPluginBase.InputDefinition
member.summary: The InputDefinition class is a class for defining the plug-in dependency over the input (points or identifiers). The user implemented method DefineInput() of the DrawingPluginBase interface should return an array list of input definition instances. This defines the points and identifiers the plug-in will receive as input when the Run() method is called.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.DrawingPluginBase.InputDefinition.Initialize
member.summary: Initializes classes fields.
member.returns: Always true.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.DrawingPluginBase.InputDefinition.#ctor
member.summary: Base constructor. Initializes all fields. This should be called by all constructors.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.DrawingPluginBase.InputDefinition.#ctor(Tekla.Structures.Identifier,Tekla.Structures.Geometry3d.Point)
member.summary: Creates a new input definition instance with one point.
member.param: The identifier for the view object.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.DrawingPluginBase.InputDefinition.#ctor(Tekla.Structures.Identifier,Tekla.Structures.Geometry3d.Point,Tekla.Structures.Geometry3d.Point)
member.summary: Creates a new input definition instance with two points.
member.param: The identifier for the view object.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.DrawingPluginBase.InputDefinition.#ctor(Tekla.Structures.Identifier,Tekla.Structures.Geometry3d.Point,Tekla.Structures.Geometry3d.Point,Tekla.Structures.Geometry3d.Point)
member.summary: Creates a new input definition instance with three points.
member.param: The identifier for the view object.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.DrawingPluginBase.InputDefinition.#ctor(Tekla.Structures.Identifier,System.Collections.Generic.List{Tekla.Structures.Geometry3d.Point})
member.summary: Creates a new input definition with multiple points.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.DrawingPluginBase.InputDefinition.#ctor(Tekla.Structures.Identifier,Tekla.Structures.Identifier)
member.summary: Creates a new input definition instance with one identifier.
member.param: The identifier for the view object.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.DrawingPluginBase.InputDefinition.GetInput
member.summary: Returns the input Tekla Structures gave to the plug-in. The input is either a point instance, an identifier instance, an array list of points or an array list of identifiers. This is based on the input format returned from the DefineInput() method.
member.returns: The input to use in the Run() method.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.DrawingPluginBase.InputDefinition.Type
member.summary: The type of the input the current instance contains.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.DrawingPluginBase.InputDefinition.ViewId
member.summary: The view object's identifier.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.DrawingPluginBase.InputDefinition.InputTypes
member.summary: The possible input types for a drawing plug-in.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.DrawingPluginBase.InputDefinition.InputTypes.INPUT_ONE_POINT
member.summary: The input has one point.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.DrawingPluginBase.InputDefinition.InputTypes.INPUT_TWO_POINTS
member.summary: The input has two points.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.DrawingPluginBase.InputDefinition.InputTypes.INPUT_THREE_POINTS
member.summary: The input has three points.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.DrawingPluginBase.InputDefinition.InputTypes.INPUT_N_POINTS
member.summary: The input has multiple points.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.DrawingPluginBase.InputDefinition.InputTypes.INPUT_ONE_OBJECT
member.summary: The input has one drawing object. The supported drawing objects are bolts, parts and rebars. Bolts, parts and rebars are drawing objects derived from model objects. The parts include the beam, the contour plate and the polybeam.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.UpdateModeAttribute.#ctor(Tekla.Structures.Plugins.DrawingPluginBase.UpdateMode)
member.summary: DO NOT USE! For internal usage only!

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.UpdateModeAttribute.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: DO NOT USE! For internal usage only!

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.UpdateModeAttribute.Type
member.summary: DO NOT USE! For internal usage only!

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.PluginBase
member.summary:
The PluginBase class in an abstract base class for model plug-ins. Model plug-ins have to be inherited from this class. Drawing plug-ins have to be inherited from the DrawingPluginBase.
A plug-in is always executed in the plug-in's local coordinate system. The origin of the plug-in's coordinate system is defined based on the first input object or point. In case the first input is an object, the origin of the plug-in's coordinate system is the first input point of the object. In case the first input is a point, the origin of the plug-in's coordinate system is the input point. The X- and Y-axes of the coordinate system are defined in the current plane.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.PluginBase._Identifier
member.summary: The identifier of the executable plug-in instance.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.PluginBase.InitializeLifetimeService
member.summary: Initializes the lifetime service.
member.returns: A lifetime service object to control the lifetime policy.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.PluginBase.Run(System.Collections.Generic.List{Tekla.Structures.Plugins.PluginBase.InputDefinition})
member.summary: The main method of the plug-in. It is called after the input has been defined with DefineInput(). This is the "main" method of the plug-in and should contain all the actual implementation.
member.param: A list of the same format and order as what was returned from DefineInput().
member.returns: True on success.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.PluginBase.DefineInput
member.summary: The method Tekla Structures calls for the plug-in to query the input. The plug-in must then return a list of input definition instances. The plug-in will be dependent on the items it returns. Dependent means that if any of these items change, for example the user moves the points, the plug-in will be re-run with new input. DefineInput is not called during the re-run, and thus all the actual implementation should be in the Run() method. The maximum number of InputDefinitions in the List is 10.
member.returns: A list of input definition instances. If the plug-in is not dependent on input, it should return an empty list (not null).

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.PluginBase.IsDefaultValue(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns true if the given value is set to the default value for this type.
member.returns: True if the value is set to the default.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.PluginBase.IsDefaultValue(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns true if the given value is set to the default value for this type.
member.returns: True if the value is set to the default.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.PluginBase.IsDefaultValue(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if the given value is set to the default value (empty string).
member.returns: True if the value is set to the default.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.PluginBase.Identifier
member.summary: The identifier of the executable plug-in instance.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.PluginBase.InputDefinition
member.summary: The InputDefinition class is a class for defining the plug-in dependency over the input (points or identifiers). The user implemented method DefineInput() of the PluginBase interface should return an array list of input definition instances. This defines the points and identifiers the plug-in will receive as input when the Run() method is called.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.PluginBase.InputDefinition.#ctor(Tekla.Structures.Geometry3d.Point)
member.summary: Creates a new input definition instance with one point.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.PluginBase.InputDefinition.#ctor(Tekla.Structures.Geometry3d.Point,Tekla.Structures.Geometry3d.Point)
member.summary: Creates a new input definition instance with two points.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.PluginBase.InputDefinition.#ctor(System.Collections.ArrayList)
member.summary: Creates a new input definition instance with multiple point or identifier instances.
member.param: A list of either points or identifiers.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.PluginBase.InputDefinition.#ctor(Tekla.Structures.Identifier)
member.summary: Creates a new input definition instance with one identifier.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.PluginBase.InputDefinition.GetInputType
member.summary: Returns the type of the input the current instance contains.
member.returns: The type of the input.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.PluginBase.InputDefinition.GetInput
member.summary: Returns the input Tekla Structures gave to the plug-in. The input is either a point instance, an identifier instance, an array list of points or an array list of identifiers. This is based on the input format returned from the DefineInput() method.
member.returns: The input to use in the Run() method.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.PluginBase.InputDefinition.InputTypeEnum
member.summary: The possible input types for a plug-in.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.PluginBase.InputDefinition.InputTypeEnum.INPUT_ONE_POINT
member.summary: The input is one point (x,y,z).

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.PluginBase.InputDefinition.InputTypeEnum.INPUT_TWO_POINTS
member.summary: The input is two points.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.PluginBase.InputDefinition.InputTypeEnum.INPUT_POLYGON
member.summary: The input is multiple points.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.PluginBase.InputDefinition.InputTypeEnum.INPUT_ONE_OBJECT
member.summary: The input is one ID of any type.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.PluginBase.InputDefinition.InputTypeEnum.INPUT_N_OBJECTS
member.summary: The input is N IDs of any type.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.PluginBase.InputObjectDependency
member.summary: Defines the input object dependency type for model plug-ins.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.PluginBase.InputObjectDependency.NOT_DEPENDENT
member.summary: No dependency on input. Typically this type is applied to the import and export functionality. Not-dependent plug-ins are executed from the plug-in dialog instead of the component catalog. The created objects do not have any relation to the plug-in anymore. The plug-in dialog cannot be opened from the created objects. Note! The system does not automatically save a rollback point to the database for non-dependent plug-ins. If new objects are created, CommitChanges needs to be called at the end of the Run method.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.PluginBase.InputObjectDependency.DEPENDENT
member.summary: Dependent on input. The plug-in is executed if e.g. the definition points or the profile of the input part change. Boolean operations to the input part do not cause plug-in execution.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.PluginBase.InputObjectDependency.GEOMETRICALLY_DEPENDENT
member.summary: Geometrically dependent on input. The plug-in is executed if the input part geometry changes i.e. if the input part is fitted.

member.name: F:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.PluginBase.InputObjectDependency.NOT_DEPENDENT_MODIFIABLE
member.summary: No dependency on input but the instance is modifiable in the model. The created objects have a relation to the plug-in. The plug-in dialog can be opened from the created objects.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.PluginAttribute
member.summary: The PluginAttribute class is used for storing the name of the plug-in to the system. The attribute is initialized from the custom attribute [Plugin("PluginName")] in the plug-in source.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.PluginAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: The custom attribute [Plugin("PluginName")] uses this to store the name to the system. This is not to be used by itself.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.PluginAttribute.Name
member.summary: The name of the plug-in in the system.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.PluginUserInterfaceAttribute
member.summary: The PluginUserInterfaceAttribute class is used for storing the description of the plug-in user interface to the system. The attribute is initialized from the custom attribute [PluginUserInterface(PluginName.UserInterfaceDefinitions.Plugin1)] in the plug-in source. In this case the description string Plugin1 is a dialog written in inp format. If the plug-in dialog is inherited from the PluginFormBase the description string contains a class name of the dialog i.e. [PluginUserInterface("Model_Plug_in1.MainForm")].

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.PluginUserInterfaceAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: The custom attribute [PluginUserInterface(PluginName.UserInterfaceDefinitions.Plugin1)] uses this to store the description of the plug-in user interface to the system. This is not to be used by itself.
member.param: The description of the plug-in user interface in inp format or the name of the dialog class for the PluginFormBase dialog.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.PluginUserInterfaceAttribute.Description
member.summary: The description of the plug-in user interface in inp format.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.PluginNameAttribute
member.summary: Not supported at the moment.

member.summary: Not supported at the moment.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.StructuresFieldAttribute
member.summary: The StructuresFieldAttribute class is used for mapping a database attribute to a data field that the plug-in uses in execution. The attribute is initialized from the custom attribute [StructuresField(attributeName)] in the plug-in source. In the plug-in the data field must be public and the type must be double, integer or string.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.StructuresFieldAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: The custom attribute [StructuresField(attributeName)] uses this to map a database attribute to a data field that the plug-in uses in execution. This is not to be used by itself.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.StructuresFieldAttribute.AttributeName
member.summary: The name of the attribute.

member.name: T:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.InputObjectDependencyAttribute
member.summary: The InputObjectDependencyAttribute class is used for storing an input object dependency which determines when the plug-in is updated in the system. The attribute is initialized from the custom attribute [InputObjectDependency(PluginBase.InputObjectDependency Type)] in the plug-in source.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.InputObjectDependencyAttribute.#ctor(Tekla.Structures.Plugins.PluginBase.InputObjectDependency)
member.summary: The custom attribute [InputObjectDependency(PluginBase.InputObjectDependency Type)] uses this to store a dependency attribute which determines when the plug-in is updated in the system. This is not to be used by itself.
member.param: The type of the input object dependency.

member.name: M:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.InputObjectDependencyAttribute.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: The custom attribute [InputObjectDependency(PluginBase.InputObjectDependency Type)] uses this to store a dependency attribute which determines when the plug-in is updated in the system. This is not to be used by itself.
member.param: The type of the input object dependency as an integer.

member.name: P:Tekla.Structures.Plugins.InputObjectDependencyAttribute.Type
member.summary: Returns the type of the input object dependency.
